page.title: 06Housing
page.content:
We found by walking every street in 3 km squares that more than half the area is residential. We used a map of all 12 squares to record numbers. A grid overlay on the map and co-ordinates chosen at random were used to pinpoint 300 houses: we found 79% terraced 12% semi-detached and 9% detached. This agrees with the high density housing we saw and the scarcity of detached houses and large plots. We grouped the age of houses into Victorian, Inter-War and Modern (virtually no houses prior to 1837). The majority are Victorian and Inter-War, corresponding to the great expansion of London suburbs and the provision of good road and rail links.
Continued on page 7.
